bug.author: paveldournov
bug.summary: Namespace selection UI is half hidden by navigation bar
bug.description: KF 0.6, deployment on 7/19 from Master KF main dashboard, namespace selector When clicking on the namespace selector at the top of the page, the drop down is half way hidden by the left nav pane, making it impossible to see the names of the namespaces. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4884947/61571919-34b4a080-aa4c-11e9-9608-838b8a7c6479.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.90. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> Do we need to build a new docker image and update the manifest <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/v0.6-branch/common/centraldashboard/base/kustomization.yaml>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/v0.6-branch/common/centraldashboard/base/kustomization.yaml</denchmark-link>
It looks like the current image is pointing at v0.6.0-rc2 which is 6 days old and thus likely from before the PR was submitted. It looks like there is a newer image: v20190726-v0.6.0-rc.0-30-g2141a36b It looks like this is coming from pull request <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commit/2141a36b>2141a36</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> Ideally we would do the following
Cherry-pick required changes on to the v0.6-branch of kubeflow/kubeflow Build and push an image from the v0.6-branch update the manifests on the v0.6-branch of kubeflow/manifests
Should we do that?

I see, let's stash this till v0.6.2, since the image you mentioned includes partial upgrades for the Multi-User isolation CUJ. <denchmark-h:h3>Edit:</denchmark-h>
Now that Manage-Users is done, we can bundle all the changes together.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> What's the ETA for getting a docker image built with the changes and getting kubeflow/manifests updated to include the changes?

The images are already made, the PRs still have some work that needs to be done:
Addressing UX Review Addressing minor testing comments on #3758
I already have the images built with functional up-to-date changes (gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/centraldashboard:v20190801-v0.6.0-rc.0-44-g5b463203). If you'd like I can make that image as the target and satisfy <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3795>#3795</denchmark-link>
Or I can wait till those changes are done, and then build a new set. (functionally there will be no difference as mostly there are 1-2 UX tweaks and new tests that are added)
/close In favor of Cherrypick Issue aforementioned

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
In response to this:
/close In favor of Cherrypick Issue aforementioned
Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available here. If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the kubernetes/test-infra repository.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> What docker image includes the fix? And have we updated kubeflow/manifests to use the new image?
